intro: Camphorosma pteranthus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf camphorosma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, narrow leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typical of the daisy family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its ecological significance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
